thread.title: nubia Z11 miniS with 23MP camera and Snapdragon 625 launched for Rs 16,999
thread.title_full: nubia Z11 miniS with 23MP camera and Snapdragon 625 launched for Rs 16,999

title: nubia Z11 miniS with 23MP camera and Snapdragon 625 launched for Rs 16,999
text:
nubia Z11 miniS with 23MP camera and Snapdragon 625 launched for Rs... nubia Z11 miniS with 23MP camera and Snapdragon 625 launched for Rs 16,999 By March 20, 2017 “The Z11 miniS features a 13MP selfie camera, metal design and 4GB RAM” 
After launching the Z11 ( review ) and N1 ( review ) in India last December, ZTE’s sub-brand nubia has added a new Z series smartphone to its portfolio in the country. The brand has launched the nubia Z11 miniS as a variant of the Z11. The camera-centric smartphone’s biggest highlight is a 23MP Sony IMX318 primary shooter with phase detection autofocus, 6P lens and an LED flash. For selfies, the device gets a 13MP front shooter with a Sony IMX258 sensor and screen flash. 
As far as the other specs are concerned, the nubia Z11 miniS features a metal unibody design with a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor. The phone sports a 5.2-inch full HD display with a pixel density of 424ppi. The performance is handled by a 2.0GHz octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 625 SoC, mated to 4GB of RAM and 64GB storage, expandable up to to 256GB via microSD. 
The nubia Z11 miniS comes with 4G LTE, VoLTE, a USB Type-C port, dual-SIM slots, dual-band Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.1 and GPS for connectivity. The phone is fuelled by a non-removable 3,000mAh battery. Software-wise, the device boots Android 6.0 Marshmallow with nubia UI 4.0. The phone also gets gestures support like swiping on the edge takes you back to recent apps and more. 
The 64GB nubia Z11 miniS has been priced at Rs 16,999. The phone will be available in Khaki Grey and Moon Gold hues exclusively on Amazon India starting 4pm on March 21st. Facebook Comments
